channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: The year data centers went from backend to center stage
item.description: Data centers are no longer the boring tech issue they once were.

item.title: Is the Internet's time wrong? NIST warns servers may have lapsed due to a power outage
item.description: NIST warns specific public time servers may be inaccurate after a power outage disrupted atomic clock distribution.

item.title: How to watch Midnight Mass 2025 — live stream First Mass of the Nativity for free
item.description: The BBC bring live coverage of the First Mass of the Nativity. Here's how to watch Midnight Mass 2025 online and from anywhere.

item.title: Guess where all the NAND flash components are going? The 8th (yes, eighth) 245TB SSD has been announced amidst race to quench AI storage thirst of hyperscalers
item.description: DapuStor announces a 245TB class SSD as AI workloads continue to shape flash storage priorities in hyperscale data centers.

item.title: S&P 500 reaches a record high as ‘Santa Claus rally’ kicks off
item.description: The S&P 500 gained 10.24 points, or 0.15%, to 6,920.24. The S&P 500 hit a record high on Wednesday, with broad-gains across sectors supporting the main indexes during a shortened Christmas Eve session.

item.title: Steam and Valve's online games are down
item.description: Steam is experiencing an outage that’s impacting users ability to access the game store and play games online. Valve hasn’t acknowledged the outage publicly, but SteamDB’s unofficial Steam Status page reports that the Steam Store, Steam Community, and Steam Web APIs are all offline.DownDetector received over 6,000 outage reports around 1:15PM ET, and Steam is also inaccessible from Valve’s mobile apps. The outage appears to be affecting APIs for Valve’s online games, like Team Fortress 2, Dota 2 and Counterstrike 2, as well.Steam’s last major outage was in October, when the store and online se...

item.title: Redactions in Epstein files viewable by copying and pasting, reports say
item.description: The Justice Department is struggling to comply with the Epstein Files Transparency Act.

item.title: Newegg sells this superfast $1,179 Dell mini PC for just $700 — save 40% on this ultracompact PC and get free NordVPN worth $50
item.description: Get the power of a diminutive Dell desktop for under $700, but only for a limited time.

item.title: WTF Is This Version of ‘It’s A Wonderful Life’?
item.description: We still can't get over that an oddly abridged version of the film actually exists.

item.title: OpenAI admits prompt injection is here to stay as enterprises lag on defenses
item.description: It's refreshing when a leading AI company states the obvious. In a detailed post on hardening ChatGPT Atlas against prompt injection, OpenAI acknowledged what security practitioners have known for years: "Prompt injection, much like scams and social engineering on the web, is unlikely to ever be fully 'solved.'"What’s new isn’t the risk — it’s the admission. OpenAI, the company deploying one of the most widely used AI agents, confirmed publicly that agent mode “expands the security threat surface” and that even sophisticated defenses can’t offer deterministic guarantees. For enterprises alread...
